title: California Senate Bill 100
summary: Sets a target for 100% of retail sales of electricity to be sourced from renewable and zero-carbon resources by 2045. It also accelerates previous state targets for renewable energy.
plain_summary: California must get all its electricity from clean energy by 2045. It speeds up the state's switch to green power.

title: British Columbia Carbon Tax
summary: Implements a revenue-neutral carbon tax on the purchase and use of fossil fuels. It was the first broad-based carbon tax in North America.
plain_summary: Places a fee on fossil fuels to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The money collected is used to lower other taxes for residents.

title: Single-Use Plastics Directive
summary: Bans certain single-use plastic products where alternatives are available and affordable. It targets the top ten plastic items found on European beaches.
plain_summary: Makes it illegal to sell single-use plastics like straws and cutlery. The goal is to stop plastic waste from polluting the oceans.

title: Norway Electric Vehicle Incentives
summary: Exempts fully electric vehicles from purchase taxes and VAT while providing benefits like reduced toll fares. This has made Norway the global leader in EV adoption.
plain_summary: Offers huge tax breaks and perks for buying electric cars instead of gas cars. This makes electric cars cheaper than regular ones in Norway.

title: Payments for Environmental Services
summary: Provides financial incentives to landowners who protect forests and manage land sustainably. It helped reverse the country's severe deforestation trend.
plain_summary: Pays farmers and landowners to protect trees instead of cutting them down. This helped Costa Rica regrow its lost forests.

title: China National Emission Trading Scheme
summary: Establishes the world's largest carbon market by volume initially covering the power sector. It allocates emissions allowances and allows trading among entities.
plain_summary: Creates a market where power plants can buy and sell the right to pollute. This encourages companies to lower their carbon emissions.

title: Climate Change Act 2008
summary: Legally binds the UK government to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 100% of 1990 levels by 2050. It establishes carbon budgets to chart the trajectory.
plain_summary: A law that forces the UK to bring its carbon emissions down to net-zero by 2050. The government has to stick to strict carbon budgets.

title: Renewable Energy Sources Act
summary: Introduced feed-in tariffs to guarantee above-market rates for renewable electricity producers. It drove the massive expansion of wind and solar in Germany.
plain_summary: Pays people and companies a guaranteed price for producing renewable energy. It helped Germany build a massive amount of wind and solar power.

title: Rwanda Plastic Bag Ban
summary: Prohibits the manufacturing use and sale of non-biodegradable polythene bags. The strict enforcement made Kigali one of the cleanest cities in Africa.
plain_summary: Bans the use of regular plastic bags everywhere in the country. People must use paper or reusable bags instead.

title: National Solar Mission
summary: Aims to establish India as a global leader in solar energy by creating policy conditions for solar technology diffusion. The target was massively upscaled to 100 GW by 2022.
plain_summary: A massive government push to build solar power plants across India. It wants to make solar power cheap and accessible for everyone.

title: Carbon Pricing Mechanism
summary: Introduced a price on carbon for the biggest polluters before being repealed in 2014. During its operation it successfully reduced national greenhouse gas emissions.
plain_summary: Forced big companies to pay a tax on their pollution. It was cancelled a few years later but worked well while active.

title: Tokyo Cap-and-Trade Program
summary: The world's first city-level emissions trading scheme targeting large commercial and industrial buildings. It requires mandatory CO2 reductions.
plain_summary: A city rule that limits how much pollution big office buildings and factories can make. They can trade pollution permits if they go under the limit.

title: Brazil Forest Code
summary: Requires private landowners in the Amazon to maintain 80% of their land as native forest. It provides the legal framework for combating illegal deforestation.
plain_summary: Forces farmers and landowners in the Amazon to keep most of their land as natural forest. It aims to stop illegal logging.

title: South Africa Carbon Tax
summary: Imposes a tax on greenhouse gas emissions from industrial sources. It includes generous initial tax-free allowances to ease the transition.
plain_summary: Makes big polluters pay a tax on the greenhouse gases they release. It gives companies some time to adjust before the tax gets high.

title: General Law on Climate Change
summary: Establishes legal mandates for reducing emissions by 30% by 2020 and 50% by 2050 compared to baseline. It created a national climate change institute.
plain_summary: Sets official goals for Mexico to cut down its greenhouse gases. It created a special government group to study and fight climate change.

title: Extended Producer Responsibility Law
summary: Forces manufacturers of priority products like tires and packaging to organize and finance their recycling. It aims to boost the national recycling rate.
plain_summary: Makes the companies that create products responsible for recycling them when they become trash. This covers things like old tires and plastic packaging.

title: Energy Transition for Green Growth Law
summary: A comprehensive law aiming to halve energy consumption by 2050 and reduce the share of nuclear power. It strongly promotes renewables and circular economy practices.
plain_summary: A big law to help France use less energy and rely less on nuclear power. It pushes for more wind and solar power and less waste.

title: Sweden Carbon Tax
summary: Levies a high tax on carbon-intensive fuels used for heating and transportation. It is largely credited with decoupling Sweden's economic growth from its emissions.
plain_summary: A high tax on polluting fuels like oil and gas. It helped Sweden grow its economy while shrinking its carbon footprint.

title: Zero Carbon Act
summary: Sets a legally binding target to reduce net carbon emissions to zero by 2050. It treats biogenic methane from agriculture separately with its own reduction target.
plain_summary: Requires New Zealand to balance out all its carbon pollution by 2050. It handles farming emissions a bit differently since agriculture is so big there.

title: South Korea Emissions Trading Scheme
summary: The first nationwide cap-and-trade system in East Asia covering over 70% of national greenhouse gas emissions. It is a key tool for meeting the country's NDC.
plain_summary: A national market where major polluters must trade permits for their emissions. It covers almost all the big factories and power plants in South Korea.

title: Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act
summary: Mandates 100% zero-emission electricity by 2040 and an 85% reduction in statewide emissions by 2050. It mandates investments in disadvantaged communities.
plain_summary: Requires New York State to use only clean power by 2040 and slash all pollution. It ensures poor neighborhoods get a fair share of green funds.

title: Greenhouse Gas Pollution Pricing Act
summary: Establishes a federal carbon pricing backstop for provinces that do not have their own adequate carbon pricing system. It ensures a minimum price on carbon nationwide.
plain_summary: Creates a backup carbon tax for Canadian provinces that refuse to make their own. It guarantees that pollution costs money everywhere in Canada.

title: Ultra Low Emission Zone
summary: Imposes a daily fee on highly polluting vehicles driving into central London. It was expanded to cover all London boroughs to drastically improve urban air quality.
plain_summary: Charges a fee to drivers of older polluting cars if they enter London. This successfully cleaned up the city's toxic air.

title: Kenya Plastic Bag Ban
summary: Implements one of the world's strictest bans on the use manufacturing and importation of single-use plastic bags. Violators face massive fines or jail time.
plain_summary: A very strict law that makes it a crime to use make or bring plastic bags into Kenya. It has significantly reduced plastic trash in the country.

title: Singapore Carbon Tax
summary: Applies a uniform carbon tax on all facilities producing 25000 tonnes or more of greenhouse gas emissions annually. It is the first carbon tax in Southeast Asia.
plain_summary: The first tax on pollution in Southeast Asia targeting large factories and power plants. It applies the same tax rate to all big polluters.

title: Colombia Carbon Tax
summary: Taxes the carbon content of fossil fuels to fund environmental and peace-building initiatives. Companies can offset their tax liability by investing in certified forestry projects.
plain_summary: Taxes fossil fuels and uses the money to protect the environment and support peace in the country. Companies can avoid the tax by planting trees.

title: Renewable Energy Law 27191
summary: Mandates that 20% of the national electricity consumption must come from renewable sources by 2025. It created the RenovAr auction program to drive investments.
plain_summary: Requires Argentina to get a fifth of its power from clean sources by 2025. It created a bidding system to attract wind and solar companies.

title: Clean Air Act
summary: Outlines a comprehensive air quality management policy and program banning incinerators. It sets emission standards for vehicles and industrial facilities.
plain_summary: A major law to clean up the air which famously banned burning trash in incinerators. It forces cars and factories to limit the smoke they release.

title: Forest Moratorium
summary: Suspends the granting of new concessions for logging and plantations in primary forests and peatlands. It aims to reduce emissions from deforestation and land degradation.
plain_summary: Stops the government from giving out new permits to cut down ancient forests and peat swamps. It is meant to protect wildlife and lower emissions.

title: Environmental Protection Law
summary: Overhauls the environmental legal framework to include circular economy principles and a roadmap for a domestic carbon market. It shifts focus to pollution prevention.
plain_summary: A huge update to Vietnam's environmental laws that introduces recycling plans and a carbon market. It focuses on stopping pollution before it happens.

title: Bio-Circular-Green Economy Model
summary: A national strategy promoting sustainable agriculture bioplastics and renewable energy to escape the middle-income trap. It aims to make the economy highly sustainable.
plain_summary: A master plan to grow Thailand's economy using green tech recycling and smart farming. It wants to make the country wealthy without ruining nature.

title: Renewable Energy Act
summary: Establishes a feed-in tariff system to encourage the generation of renewable energy. It established the Sustainable Energy Development Authority to manage the fund.
plain_summary: Pays people for generating solar or biomass energy and feeding it into the grid. It created a special agency to handle green energy funds.

title: Netherlands Climate Act
summary: Sets legally binding targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 49% by 2030 and 95% by 2050. It mandates an annual climate plan review by parliament.
plain_summary: Forces the Dutch government to drastically cut emissions by 2030 and 2050. Politicians must review their progress every single year.

title: Climate Change and Energy Transition Law
summary: Bans new fossil fuel exploration and mandates that 74% of electricity must come from renewable sources by 2030. It sets a path toward climate neutrality by 2050.
plain_summary: Stops all new searches for oil and gas in Spain and pushes for huge growth in wind and solar power. It aims to make Spain climate-neutral.

title: Italy Plastic Tax
summary: Levies a tax on single-use plastic products designed for containment protection or delivery of goods. It aims to discourage plastic consumption and fund recycling.
plain_summary: Charges a fee on items made of single-use plastic like bottles and packaging. The goal is to make people use less plastic.

title: Switzerland CO2 Act
summary: Provides the legal basis for Switzerland's carbon tax and emissions trading scheme. It requires the federal government to reduce emissions using market mechanisms.
plain_summary: The main law that allows Switzerland to tax carbon and run an emissions market. It focuses on using the economy to drive down pollution.

title: Waste Management Act
summary: Implements strict guidelines for recycling waste separation and the operation of landfills. It makes Austria one of the top recyclers in the European Union.
plain_summary: Sets very strict rules for how trash must be sorted recycled and thrown away. It helped make Austria one of the best countries at recycling.

title: Climate Change Act
summary: A framework act establishing a planning system for climate policy to achieve carbon neutrality by 2035. It is one of the most ambitious national climate targets globally.
plain_summary: Sets a super ambitious goal for Finland to be totally carbon neutral by 2035. It creates a strict roadmap for the government to follow.

title: Iceland Climate Action Plan
summary: Outlines measures to achieve a 40% reduction in emissions by 2030 focusing on transport and carbon sequestration. It heavily subsidizes the shift to electric vehicles.
plain_summary: A plan to cut emissions by planting trees and getting everyone to drive electric cars. It uses Iceland's clean grid to power green transport.

title: Climate Action and Low Carbon Development Act
summary: Commits Ireland to a legally binding target of net-zero greenhouse gas emissions no later than 2050. It introduces five-year carbon budgets.
plain_summary: Forces Ireland by law to hit net-zero emissions by 2050. The government has to stick to strict five-year plans to stay on track.

title: Washington Climate Commitment Act
summary: Creates a comprehensive cap-and-invest program to reduce carbon pollution and achieve net-zero emissions by 2050. Revenue funds climate resilience and environmental justice.
plain_summary: Sets a hard limit on pollution that gets lower over time. The money raised from polluters is spent on green projects and helping poor communities.

title: Quebec Cap-and-Trade System
summary: Links with California's carbon market to cap greenhouse gas emissions from major industries. The auction revenues are reinvested in green technologies.
plain_summary: A market linked with California where factories buy permits to pollute. The money from permits is used to fund green technology in Quebec.

title: NSW Greenhouse Gas Reduction Scheme
summary: One of the world's first mandatory emissions trading schemes for electricity retailers. It required retailers to meet emission benchmarks or pay a penalty.
plain_summary: An early program that forced electricity companies to lower their emissions or pay a fine. It helped kickstart green energy in Australia.

title: Feed-in Tariff for Renewable Energy
summary: Introduced highly attractive tariffs for solar power following the Fukushima disaster to rapidly boost renewable capacity. It led to a massive surge in solar installations.
plain_summary: Paid extremely high prices to anyone generating solar power after the nuclear disaster. It caused a huge boom in solar panels across Japan.

title: Sao Paulo State Climate Change Policy
summary: Sets an ambitious goal to reduce the state's greenhouse gas emissions by 20% by 2020. It focused on transportation and industrial efficiency.
plain_summary: A state-level plan to cut pollution by 20% focusing on better cars and cleaner factories. It set an example for the rest of Brazil.

title: Western Cape Green Economy Strategy
summary: Aims to position the province as the leading green economic hub of Africa focusing on renewable energy manufacturing. It supports solar installations and water resilience.
plain_summary: A plan to make the region the green tech capital of Africa. It focuses on building solar panels and saving water.

title: Mexico City ProAire
summary: A comprehensive air quality management program aiming to reduce transport emissions and industrial pollution. It significantly reduced smog levels in the capital.
plain_summary: A major plan to clean up the notoriously smoggy air in Mexico City. It restricted driving and forced factories to install filters.

title: Chile Carbon Tax
summary: Applies a carbon tax of $5 per ton to large stationary sources like power plants. It was the first carbon tax enacted in South America.
plain_summary: The first tax on carbon pollution in South America targeting big power plants. It charges a small fee for every ton of carbon they emit.

title: Anti-Waste for a Circular Economy Law
summary: Phases out single-use plastics bans the destruction of unsold non-food products and mandates repairability indexes. It completely overhauls France's approach to waste.
plain_summary: Bans companies from destroying unsold clothes and electronics. It also requires a repair score on gadgets to help people fix things instead of throwing them away.

title: Sweden Climate Act
summary: Establishes a legally binding requirement for the government's climate policy to align with long-term emissions goals. It requires an annual climate report to parliament.
plain_summary: Forces the Swedish government to ensure all its policies match its climate goals. The politicians must report their progress every year.

title: Zero Deforestation Procurement Policy
summary: Commits the government to ensuring its supply chains do not contribute to deforestation. It bans the procurement of products linked to rainforest destruction.
plain_summary: A rule that stops the government from buying anything that causes forests to be cut down. It helps protect the Amazon and other rainforests.

title: Denmark Climate Act
summary: Sets a legally binding target to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 70% by 2030 compared to 1990 levels. It is one of the most aggressive 2030 targets globally.
plain_summary: A law that forces Denmark to cut its pollution by a massive 70% by 2030. It is one of the toughest climate goals in the world.

title: New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme
summary: The principal policy tool to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by pricing carbon across the economy. Uniquely it includes the forestry sector as carbon sinks.
plain_summary: A national market for carbon pollution that includes planting trees to absorb carbon. It is the main tool New Zealand uses to fight climate change.

title: Seoul Building Retrofit Program
summary: Provides low-interest loans to building owners to improve energy efficiency. It is a core part of the city's One Less Nuclear Power Plant initiative.
plain_summary: Gives cheap loans to landlords so they can upgrade their buildings to use less energy. This helps the city avoid building new power plants.

title: Global Warming Solutions Act
summary: Requires the state to reduce emissions by at least 80% below 1990 levels by 2050. It mandates the creation of sector-specific emissions reduction plans.
plain_summary: Forces the state to cut pollution by 80% by 2050 and create specific plans for transport and buildings to get there.

title: Ontario Coal Phase-Out
summary: Successfully eliminated coal-fired electricity generation in the province by 2014. It stands as one of the largest single greenhouse gas reduction actions in North America.
plain_summary: Shut down all the coal power plants in the province. This drastically cleaned up the air and removed a massive amount of carbon pollution.

title: Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism
summary: Places a carbon price on imports of certain highly polluting goods from outside the EU. It aims to prevent carbon leakage and encourage global decarbonization.
plain_summary: A tax on dirty products imported into Europe from other countries. It stops companies from moving their factories to places with weak environmental laws.

title: Plastic Packaging Tax
summary: Applies a tax on plastic packaging manufactured in or imported into the UK that does not contain at least 30% recycled plastic. It heavily incentivizes recycling.
plain_summary: Charges a tax on any plastic packaging that isn't made from at least 30% recycled material. This pushes companies to use recycled plastic.

title: Coal Phase-Out Act
summary: Mandates the complete phase-out of coal-fired power generation in Germany by 2038 at the latest. It provides structural funding for affected mining regions.
plain_summary: A law that forces Germany to close all its coal power plants by 2038. It also gives money to coal towns to help them find new industries.

title: Rwanda E-Waste Management Policy
summary: Establishes a framework for the safe collection dismantling and recycling of electronic waste. It led to the creation of a massive state-of-the-art recycling facility.
plain_summary: Creates a system to safely collect and recycle old computers and phones. It funded a massive high-tech recycling center in Rwanda.

title: Gujarat Particulate Matter ETS
summary: The world's first market-based trading scheme for particulate matter pollution. It caps the total mass of particulate emissions allowed from industrial clusters.
plain_summary: The first market where factories trade permits for soot and smoke pollution. It sets a strict limit on how much smog factories can release.

title: Shenzhen Emissions Trading Scheme
summary: The first of China's pilot carbon markets covering power and manufacturing sectors. It provided crucial data for the eventual national ETS rollout.
plain_summary: A pilot program in one Chinese city where factories trade pollution permits. It was a test run for China's massive national carbon market.

title: Climate Action Plan to Reduce Pollution
summary: Sets science-based targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 90% by 2050 compared to 2005 levels. It grants broad authority to state regulators to enact rules.
plain_summary: Gives the state the power to make rules that cut pollution by 90% by 2050. It relies on science to figure out the best way to lower emissions.

title: Technology Innovation and Emissions Reduction
summary: Requires large industrial facilities to reduce their emissions intensity or pay into a fund for green technology. It is Alberta's approach to industrial carbon pricing.
plain_summary: Forces large oil and gas facilities to pollute less or pay a fine. The money from fines is used to invent new clean technologies.

title: Water Framework Directive
summary: A pioneering directive committing EU member states to achieve good qualitative and quantitative status of all water bodies. It mandates river basin management plans.
plain_summary: A major law forcing all European countries to clean up their lakes rivers and groundwater. It requires detailed plans to stop water pollution.

title: Climate Change Scotland Act
summary: Set world-leading targets for Scotland to reduce emissions with annual reporting requirements. It was updated in 2019 to target net-zero by 2045.
plain_summary: Requires Scotland to hit net-zero pollution by 2045 five years ahead of the rest of the UK. It is known for its extremely strict tracking.

title: Packaging Act
summary: Requires retailers and manufacturers to register and pay licensing fees for the packaging they introduce. It enforces high recycling quotas for all materials.
plain_summary: Forces companies to pay for the recycling of the boxes and plastic they use for their products. It makes sure almost everything gets recycled.

title: Climate Change Act
summary: Provides a regulatory framework for an enhanced response to climate change. It establishes a National Climate Change Council chaired by the President.
plain_summary: Creates a top-level government council to deal with climate change. It forces the country to make plans for droughts and floods.

title: Singapore Green Plan 2030
summary: A whole-of-nation movement to advance sustainable development involving massive tree planting and quadrupling solar energy. It targets net-zero by mid-century.
plain_summary: A huge national plan to plant trees build solar panels and reduce waste. It aims to make the small city-state super green by 2030.

title: Amazon Deforestation Control Policy
summary: Initiated after the Supreme Court recognized the Amazon as an entity with rights. It mandates action plans to halt deforestation and protect indigenous lands.
plain_summary: Started when a court ruled the Amazon rainforest has legal rights. It forces the government to stop logging and protect the jungle.

title: Native Forest Law
summary: Requires provinces to map and zone their native forests to prevent uncontrolled land clearing for agriculture. It provides a fund to compensate landowners.
plain_summary: Forces local governments to map out forests and stop farmers from bulldozing them. It pays landowners to keep their forests intact.

title: Ecological Solid Waste Management Act
summary: Requires local governments to establish waste management programs emphasizing recycling and composting. It mandates the closure of open dumpsites.
plain_summary: Forces towns and cities to shut down open trash dumps and start recycling and composting programs. It gives local mayors the responsibility to clean up.

title: Peatland Restoration Agency Mandate
summary: Established to restore millions of hectares of degraded peatlands to prevent catastrophic forest fires. It uses canal blocking and revegetation techniques.
plain_summary: A government agency created to re-wet dried-out swamps to stop massive wildfires. It blocks drainage canals and plants new trees.

title: Payment for Forest Environmental Services
summary: Requires hydropower plants and water utilities to pay forest owners for protecting watersheds. The funds are distributed to local communities for conservation.
plain_summary: Forces water and electricity companies to pay money to villagers who protect the forests. This ensures rivers stay clean and flowing.

title: National EV Policy
summary: Sets a target for zero-emission vehicles to account for 30% of total auto production by 2030. It includes consumer subsidies and tax incentives for manufacturers.
plain_summary: A plan to make 30% of all cars built in Thailand electric by 2030. It gives tax breaks to car companies and buyers.

title: National Green Technology Policy
summary: Aims to accelerate the national economy while promoting sustainable development through green technology. It focuses on energy water waste and transport.
plain_summary: A broad plan to boost the economy using green technology. It focuses on better energy clean water and smart recycling.

title: Nitrogen Reduction Program
summary: A controversial but highly impactful policy to drastically reduce agricultural nitrogen emissions to protect nature reserves. It involves buying out high-polluting farms.
plain_summary: A very strict plan to cut pollution from farm animals to protect nature. The government is even paying farmers to shut down their farms.

title: National Hydrological Plan
summary: Manages the country's scarce water resources through infrastructure and conservation. It was later modified to focus more on desalination rather than river transfers.
plain_summary: A plan to manage Spain's water shortages. It focuses on turning seawater into drinking water instead of draining rivers.

title: Superbonus 110%
summary: A massive tax credit program allowing homeowners to deduct 110% of the expenses for energy efficiency upgrades. It spurred a huge boom in building renovations.
plain_summary: A crazy tax break that gave people back more money than they spent if they made their homes energy efficient. It caused a massive boom in green renovations.

title: Energy Strategy 2050
summary: Prohibits the construction of new nuclear power plants and promotes energy efficiency and renewables. It was approved by a popular vote.
plain_summary: A plan chosen by voters to slowly shut down nuclear power plants and replace them with wind and solar power. It also pushes people to save energy.

title: Renewable Energy Expansion Act
summary: Aims to cover 100% of national electricity consumption from renewable sources by 2030. It provides a new market premium subsidy system.
plain_summary: A law requiring Austria to get all of its electricity from renewable sources by 2030. It offers new financial support for green energy projects.

title: Circular Economy Program
summary: Sets a cap on domestic raw material consumption ensuring it does not exceed 2015 levels by 2035. It aims to double the resource productivity rate.
plain_summary: A plan to stop the country from using up new natural resources. It aims to make the economy run purely on recycled and reused materials.

title: Energy Transition Fund
summary: Provides funding to accelerate the shift away from fossil fuels in transport and maritime sectors. It supports EV charging and hydrogen infrastructure.
plain_summary: A pot of money used to help ships and cars switch away from oil. It pays for electric chargers and hydrogen fuel stations.

title: Plastic Bag Levy
summary: One of the world's first taxes on plastic bags leading to a 90% drop in use within weeks. It raised millions for an environmental fund.
plain_summary: A famous early tax on plastic bags that almost completely stopped people from using them overnight. The money raised goes to environmental projects.

title: Climate and Equitable Jobs Act
summary: Requires the state to move to 100% carbon-free power by 2045 and phases out coal and natural gas. It heavily prioritizes workforce development in minority communities.
plain_summary: Forces the state to stop using coal and gas by 2045. It ensures that the new green energy jobs go to communities that need them the most.

title: Environmental Goals and Sustainable Prosperity Act
summary: Integrated environmental sustainability with economic growth setting 21 ambitious targets. It made Nova Scotia a leader in greenhouse gas reductions in Canada.
plain_summary: A famous provincial law that proved saving the environment helps the economy grow. It set strict targets for cutting pollution and boosting green jobs.

title: Victoria Climate Change Act
summary: Establishes a legislative foundation for the state to achieve net-zero emissions by 2050. It requires the government to set five-yearly interim emissions targets.
plain_summary: A state law that mandates reaching net-zero pollution by 2050. Politicians must create a new stepping-stone goal every five years to guarantee progress.

title: Basic Hydrogen Strategy
summary: The world's first national strategy to create a hydrogen-based society. It focuses on importing green hydrogen and expanding fuel cell vehicles.
plain_summary: The world's first big plan to run the country on hydrogen fuel. It focuses on hydrogen cars and importing clean hydrogen from overseas.

title: National Biofuels Policy
summary: Establishes annual carbon intensity reduction targets for fuel distributors. It generates tradable credits to incentivize the production of biofuels like ethanol.
plain_summary: A program that forces fuel companies to lower their carbon footprint. They do this by buying credits from companies that make green biofuels.

title: National Environmental Management Act
summary: The foundational environmental law in South Africa establishing principles for sustainable development. It mandates environmental impact assessments for large projects.
plain_summary: The main environmental rulebook for South Africa. It says you must study how a new building or mine will hurt nature before you can build it.

title: Energy Transition Law
summary: Mandates that clean energy sources must account for 35% of total electricity generation by 2024. It established clean energy certificates for power generators.
plain_summary: Requires Mexico to get 35% of its power from clean sources by 2024. It created green certificates that power companies have to buy.

title: Framework Law on Climate Change
summary: Enshrines the goal of carbon neutrality by 2050 into law. It forces all state organs to incorporate climate change into their sectoral planning.
plain_summary: Makes it illegal for Chile to miss its net-zero pollution goal by 2050. It forces every part of the government to help fight climate change.

title: Law for the Recovery of Biodiversity
summary: Created the French Agency for Biodiversity and banned neonicotinoid pesticides. It heavily focuses on protecting ecosystems and marine environments.
plain_summary: Created a new government agency just for protecting nature and banned chemicals that kill bees. It strongly protects oceans and forests.

title: Climate Bonus for Low Emission Vehicles
summary: A bonus-malus system rewarding buyers of low-emission cars with cash bonuses while heavily taxing high-emission vehicles. It skyrocketed EV sales.
plain_summary: A system that gives you cash if you buy an electric car but taxes you heavily if you buy a gas guzzler. It made electric cars very popular.

title: Norway CO2 Tax
summary: One of the oldest carbon taxes in the world heavily applied to the offshore oil and gas industry. It drove early investments in carbon capture technology.
plain_summary: A very old tax on pollution that mostly hits the oil and gas industry. It forced those companies to invent new ways to trap carbon.

title: Wind Energy Subsidy Program
summary: Provided massive early subsidies and guaranteed grid access for wind turbines. It successfully birthed the modern global wind energy industry.
plain_summary: Gave lots of money and guaranteed grid connections to people building wind turbines. It essentially created the modern wind power industry.

title: Waste Minimisation Act
summary: Imposes a levy on waste sent to landfills to fund waste minimization projects. It promotes product stewardship schemes for things like e-waste.
plain_summary: Charges a fee for every ton of trash thrown in a dump. The money is used to fund recycling programs and fix electronic waste.

title: Green New Deal
summary: A massive post-COVID investment plan to digitize and green the economy. It heavily funds renewable energy smart grids and green mobility.
plain_summary: A huge government spending plan to recover from COVID-19 by building green tech. It dumps billions into solar panels smart grids and electric cars.

title: Environmental Justice Law
summary: The strongest environmental justice law in the US. It allows the state to deny permits for polluting facilities in overburdened minority communities.
plain_summary: A powerful law that stops new factories and dumps from being built in poor neighborhoods that already have too much pollution.

title: Nature Restoration Law
summary: A landmark law requiring member states to restore at least 20% of the EU's land and sea areas by 2030. It focuses on bringing nature back to degraded ecosystems.
plain_summary: A massive new law forcing European countries to fix and regrow broken ecosystems. They must restore at least a fifth of their land and sea by 2030.
